compounddef.title: Setting up server on a local machine

detaileddescription.para: In order to launch a server locally and connect to it you have to go over these 3 steps:

sect1.title: Setup database
sect1.para:
This is a generic algorithm, a more specific guide on pgAdmin is at the bottom of the document.
Open the PostgreSQL Tool for you machine.(e.g. pgAdmin for Windows)
Create a database with an arbitrary name.
Go to (Scheme script)[https://github.com/f1nal3/Juniorgram/blob/master/Utility/SQL/Database_Scheme.sql]
Execute the script from previous point on the created database.

sect1.title: Setup server

listitem.para: Go to the \ Juniorgram \ Server \ bin \ Server \ Debug folder and run cmd
Run the command in the console: Server.Exec.exe -p 65001

sect1.para: You can also launch it from the Visual Studio(or any other IDE) as long as you specify the arguments. The server will indicate that it's running correctly in the console.

sect1.title: Setup client

listitem.para: In ServerInfo.cpp, specify the address of the local host

sect1.para: That's it, if the server is launched and setup correctly, the client will connect.

listitem.para: Go to pgAdmin after copying the (Scheme script)[https://github.com/f1nal3/Juniorgram/blob/master/Utility/SQL/Database_Scheme.sql].
Right-click on Databases and then Create / Database .
Create a table with an arbitrary name.
Next, click on the created base and select the Query Tool.
Paste the previously copied code and run F5.
